page.title: 04SEA DEFENCES FOR HERNE BAY
page.content: One particularly heavy expense for the ratepayers of this area is the cost of defences against the sea. The damage caused by storms in 1978 and in 1953 indicated just how vulnerable the area could be when strong wind and high tide combined to batter the coastline. The shore on either side of the pier has long been protected by a sea wall but until recent years the coast in the extreme west of this block was unprotected and the cliffs below Beltinge were badly eroded. However by 1985 the entire coast of this block has been protected by a sea wall. Also the beaches are all protected by wooden breakwaters. The central area between the pier and the clock tower has recently been further protected by a five foot concrete wall on top of the sea wall. This should prevent the low lying town centre from being flood
